title: Worcester, Massachusetts
summary: Worcester (/ˈwʊstər/ (listen) WUUS-tər)[3] is a city in, and county seat of, Worcester County, Massachusetts, United States. Named after Worcester, Worcestershire, England, as of the 2020 Census the city's population was  206,518,[4] making it the second-most populous city in New England after Boston.[lower-alpha 1] Worcester is approximately 40 miles (64 km) west of Boston, 50 miles (80 km) east of Springfield and 40 miles (64 km) north-northwest of Providence. Due to its location near the geographic center of Massachusetts, Worcester is known as the "Heart of the Commonwealth;" a heart is the official symbol of the city.
